name: Sheraton Boston Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great location for staying in. The T is a two minute walk and with connections to the Prudential shopping mall everything is close by.
reviews.title: great location

likes.disliked: — very warm, bedroom furniture needs updating

reviews.title: Highly recommended hotel in the heart of Boston
reviews.text: Make use of the free internet facilities in the lobby and there is also a very busy starbucks. The hotel is great value for money and as we got an upgrade to a suite made the stay even more enjoyable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When travelling to the airport from the hotel get a taxi if there are more than two of you rather than a shuttle bus it works out a lot cheaper. The bell hop will try and get you to use a shuttle bus he is on commision use a cab.
reviews.title: Simply a fantastic hotel in a great city.....

likes.liked: — The free upgrade to a suite room!!!
likes.disliked: — The bathroom didn't quite match the rest of the room.

reviews.text: Being starwood preferred guests, we were upgraded to a very nice executive suite with club lounge access. We were there for an extended stay due to a medical necessity to stay in Boston. The hotel managers were very accomodating, because we had to change departure dates several times. In adddition, they were nice about adjusting our rates when the internet showed that the hotel's rates were selling for less. The connecting mall served to be extremely useful for dining out and for buying necessities. The location was excellent in Boston, and the hotel staff couldn't be nicer. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Nice!

likes.liked: — Nice spacious room with great windows on a high floor
likes.disliked: — Had to pay to get internet access in the room, but free wifi was available in the lobby

reviews.text: I stayed here right after Christmas for two nights and enjoyed the stay. The room was clean and large but outdated. The furniture was in OK condition but the room could use a refurb. They upgarded me to a mini suite that was more like just a corner room. The view however was amazing. I would stay again if the price was right.
reviews.title: Great Location Good Value Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sheraton in Boston has an incredible location if you're a shopper and/or love to eat! Its in the center of the Prudential, which has a connected walkway to Copely Square Mall. It has tons of shops and specialty stores. Good restaraunts to choose from or the food court at the Prudential has a variety of foods to choose from also. Not only that, you're within minutes to Boylston St. and Newbury St., plenty of shopping and food!
reviews.title: Nice Location!

reviews.text: The room was quite small. Not what my fiance and I are used to. We've stayed at the Park Plaza numerous times and the rooms there are much more spacious, although it needs updating. The decor at the Sheraton are up to date. Nice actually, just small. Very clean. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a decent size.
reviews.title: Internet, Pool & Location Big Draws

likes.liked: — View of Boston Harbor and Location in Prudential Center Complex

reviews.text: Check in was quick. The lines to the reception's desk were long!! Alot of the front desk people were working so it kept the lines moving quick. There's also a Kiosk computer center that you can check-in yourself. Its a self-serve center. All you need is your credit card that you used to reserve your room with and a receit along with your room keys prints out. It took less than a minute. I think every hotel should have that.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: All in all, the hotel and service was nice. Nothing spectacular, just average. Its not bad for the money at all. If you're in Boston for shopping, this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Good Location. Big Pool.

likes.disliked: — Some high rooms suffer from noise

reviews.text: As a Starwood Preffered Guest Member, we booked our stay at the Sheraton Boston Back Bay last minute with a deal using Cash and SPG Points. This was our first stay at this property, and we were pleasantly surprised with the what the hotel had to offer. We arrived at the hotel before check in and were able to get into our room without a problem. We had requested a King room and it was wonderful. Located on the 21st floor of the South Tower, we had a corner room with a great view of the city. The room was clean, comfortable and had very nice decor. The bathroom was small and simple. The only thing outdated about the hotel are the wood doors, but that really doesn't cause a problem. Our one complaint is the size of the hotel is very large and the Concierge and Front Desk continues to put you on hold. It took 3 times to get through to room service, but once ordered, the Service was prompt and the food was good. Also, we requested turn down service which is always nice to return to after a night out on the town.
reviews.title: Great Boston Hotel

likes.liked: — The Beds, Location and Room Quality
likes.disliked: — Often placed on hold by Concierge and Front Desk.

reviews.text: Overall, we had an excellent stay at the Sheraton Boston and would return again. Great location and amenities.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location

reviews.text: Spent about 5 nights at the Sheraton for a conference. The hotel wasn't cheap but the location is good & there's a Starbucks in the lobby for breakfast. The pool is small, but a welcome respite from the summer heat. Much nicer than the Philly Sheraton. I'd stay here again & the Back Bay location is nice.
reviews.title: Very disappointing!

likes.liked: — Location was the only good thing.
likes.disliked: — Run down, shabby, unclean, few amenities.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. I had a "Junior" suite with a mini fridge. No mini bar. Coffee machine present but only had paper cups with it. Way below my expectations for a 4 star hotel. Carpet was old, worn and actually had holes in it. None of the usual extras I would associate with the price like shower cap, bath robe, cork screw, shoe horn, etc. etc. Amenites included small shampoo and conditioner and a small bar of soap only.Room was large enough and with an OK view (on the 18th floor) but and furniture was old, worn and ripped in places. WiFi is extra. Overall a very disappointing experience. I got MUCH less than I expected for the price.
reviews.title: Sheraton Boston suitable to disabled travellers

likes.liked: — disabled access was excellent both in the room and in the hotel

reviews.text: Just back from a wonderful girlie shopping break in Boston staying at the Sheraton , Boston. The room allocated was wonderful giving me complete independence as a wheelchair user. The views from the room was stunning to say the least. The location of the hotel is excellent for visitors. The staff very friendly and helpful. Swimming pool as good as described in the hotel description. As the hotel holds many conferences we found the bar very busy and it was difficult to find space even to sit and have a cup of tea or coffee. We were fortunate to be able to use the private lounge for breakfast situated on the 29th floor - the Finish member of staff there was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel for someone who has limited mobility.
reviews.title: I love this hotel!

likes.disliked: — If you don't get a bay facing room the views could be poor.

reviews.text: At checkin following a long days journey the clerk informed us that they were not obligated to honor requests made on priceline (i.e. non-smoking king size bed) Instead, he offered a smoking room- when I said that would not be acceptable he said "he would see what he could do" and then placed us in a small room that had handicap accessibility-large bathroom. He told us we should not use priceline in future since they do not always have a better deal. As 4:00 AM we awakened to horrible noise coming from the walls and ceiling. When we called the desk to complain we were told that someone was probably taking a shower. When the noise stopped I asked how we knew that it would not happen again. We were told that the only was was to send maintenance (now 4:15 AM) and that we could only change to a smoking room. We declined both. At 6:00 AM we were reawakened to the banging of the pipes. When we complained again and I questioned the conversation about priceline I was told that the first clerk should not have suggested that we purposely were placed in this room (with the noise) as a result of the priceline bid but that they do not honor requests made on priceline, expedia or hotwire. I asked why they participated. They offered to compensate us for the parking and told us we should have maintenance check it out- we did and they could not do anything to fix the problem since the nosie again abated. It resumed at 7:00 AM and when we lodged our 3rd complaint the manager (now the shift had changed) offered to change our room to Lo and Behold.....an available non-smoking room with a king size bed. We shifted rooms and slept for 2 hours before moving our daughter out of her college dorm later that day on only a few hours sleep. They "comped" us for the room. NEVER again.
reviews.title: Worst experience in hotel ever!!!!

likes.disliked: — Horrible room conditions and unaccomodating staff

reviews.text: We stayed here recently for a shopping break in Boston. What we really like about this hotel is the location. Its so easy to walk downstairs to the prudential centre and all that you will need is nearby. The rooms were spacious and the free computer use in the lobby was great. The only downside was the bathrooms were a little dated (but clean).
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: Overall Id really recommend this hotel if you would like an easy break away.
reviews.title: Stay away!

reviews.text: We were there for 7 nights Apr 3 - 10 for convention. There are some positives such as the comfortable bed and friendly service. But we had to call every day to get our room cleaned because twice they forgot.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The hotel is old and tired despite recent renovations. The bathrooms are tiny and remind one of Howard Johnson's. The bathrooms need to be gutted, bathtubs changed and new counters.
reviews.title: No reimbursement for injury

reviews.text: My husband, son and I were supposed to stay at the Sheraton for three nights, we ended up staying for only two.
reviews.title: So noisy we had to check out early

reviews.text: The Sheraton is in a great location close to the lovely restaurants and shops on Newbury St., walking distance to the Commons and Public Garden, attached to the Prudential Center,and near the T station.
reviews.title: Okay but there are better options

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately though the walls are paper thin. We had to check-out a day early because we couldn't sleep at night or have quiet time during the day. We could hear EVERYTHING the people next door were saying . And they were just speaking in normal voices, they weren't being loud. The hotel didn't care about the issue and didn't offer to put us in a different room. So I would not recommend staying here if you're at all sensitive to noise.
reviews.title: Close to perfect...

reviews.text: Attended a conference at this hotel. My room had seen better days. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, there were stains on the ottoman, carpet, and a side chair. The shower curtain kept falling off the hooks.
reviews.title: Started bad, but quickly improved

reviews.text: I could hardly sleep because my room was right next to the elevators. I heard them go up and down all night. I could also hear quite a bit from the room next door--especially when the person was in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Good Location
worst Expeirence in USA
reviews.text: This is my sixth visit to the USA where everytime I stay in different hotel as part of a professional development plan wehre we attend an annual conference. This time was the worst visit and the hotel played a major role in worsening the experience.
The rooms lack the basic tiny things that we found in other hotels in other states including Sheraton ones as well.
reviews.title: Nothing Special - A bit dingy

likes.liked: — Location and Price compared to other hotels nearby
likes.disliked: — Hotel felt tired and didnt seem very personable

reviews.text: No safe inside the room to keep valuables.
reviews.title: worst club lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lighting inside the room is poor and reading was a problem.
reviews.title: Great Beds

reviews.text: Staff were nice but we were not able to get our bills in a way to report accurately to our institutions so they did whatever is suitable for them.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

reviews.text: I absolutely had the best time in Boston back on August 14th...At first i was kind of iffy about the lady who checked me in but as the process continued, she got better. I originally had booked a king room, however asked if i could have a view of the Charles River and she said a queen was available for the same cost so i switched. The room was a little small but the view was outstanding... Who goes on vacation anyway to hang out in a room??? So small was fine. It was clean and quiet and the trolley stop was right out front so convenience was everything at the Boston Sheraton. Love how it is conencted to the Prudential Center so i could walk through the mall to get my coffee in the am and also walked everywhere. Easy access to everything... The only downfall is that i am a Yankees fan and there are way way way to many Red Sox fans around there... HEHE.. Would i go back and stay at the Sheraton Boston??? Absolutely!!! in a heartbeat. Boston you are an incredible city who has bounced back from an awful tragedy... Almost forgot that the Top of the Hub restaurant is amazing...
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: Very nice hotel in a very good location in Boston. I stayed here two nights recently and enjoyed it. The room is a pretty good size for a Boston hotel, perfect for a business trip. The bed very comfortable and the bathroom nicely appointed with a great shower head. It has a Starbucks in the lobby which is very convenient and is attached to the prudential center. Plus, it has a lot of great restaurants and hang out places within a 5 minute walk of the area. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel met expectations for cleanliness, location, but the fact that they charge for wifi in the rooms is so outdated. If you they charge $300+ for a standard room, you think they would give you free wifi. Every other hotel we stayed at during our week long trip to MA gave free wifi.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location, but no free wifi in rooms? really?

reviews.text: also, when checking in, there was a line 10 people deep at 4pm on a Thursday and only one desk attendant. only after 4-5 people complained, did they add one more person. (and there were other staff at an info desk just hanging out).
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: We recently spent 5 days at the Sheraton and it was perfect for us. We paid the extra to stay on the Club Level and our room was lovely - very clean, plenty of towels and toiletries, a good view, but most of all - perfect, very comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Great hotel and good location.

reviews.text: Entering into the room at night it was breathtaking. The night view of the river and the city lights takes over the room. The room was upscale with a great flat screen tv and soft comfortable king-sized bed, but I was a little surprised that for nearly 300 dollars the bathroom was extremely small and cramped. Just enough room to get into the shower as long as you didn't need to open the door. It was very close to a cool area with lots of tasty places to eat and fancy shopping. I also was dismayed to find that you can only connect in the lobby to the wireless system or internet. (not the norm even for cheaper not so great hotels). Parking was to the left of the hotel, but was very expensive and hard to understand where to park. (39.00 a day)
reviews.title: Beautiful view of river from a rather small room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Boston Sheraton is one of our favorites. This beautiful hotel is located within easy walking distance to most of Boston's best attractions. The hotel rooms are spacious and clean and the staff is always top notch. The Concierge desk staff is super helpful, even helped us plan some day trips to other nearby cities. The hotel's proximity to the Shops at the Prudential Center are a great added bonus. The resturants at the Pru are great for a quick bite to eat! I highly reccommend the Boston Sheraton.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: This convention style hotel is located in the Back Bay. It is conveniently located two blocks from the "T"Green Line Prudential Station making for quick trip in and back to Logan Airport for only $ 2 each way and avoiding the rush hour traffic that would have made trip twice as long. The room was newly redecorated with a comfortable bed and the 15th floor offered a nice view of the Bay.
reviews.title: Fine Hotel in a Fine Location But NO Breakfast!!!
Our 1st Boston Experience
reviews.text: Check in was quick and that is not always the case when conventioneers show all at once.

reviews.title: Great location!
reviews.text: The location is a couple blocks from Boylston and Newbury Streets with plenty of top notch restaurants and shops. Really a great neighborhood. There is a large shopping mall that you can get to without going outside.

This is the second time we've stayed at the Sheraton over Patriots Day weekend. It's a great choice if you're in town for the Boston Marathon, you don't even need to go outside to get to "marathon central" at the Hines, and all the shopping and dinning you'll need. (Unless of course you head to the North End for pre-race pasta)
reviews.title: Better than Last year

reviews.text: Last time we were in a small room with our two boys and could barely walk around the roll away bed. This time our room was in the part of the hotel closest to the Prudential Center and it was quite spacious. It had a king size bed and pull out couch. The kids loved the pool, the adults enjoyed the hot tub. The fact that they allow you to use the fitness facilities to shower after the marathon is over (well after check out time) is a nice plus. We ended up arriving quite early in the morning to catch the olympic trials for the womens marathon and had no trouble leaving our car and suitcases. Once the race was over (still well before check in) we were able to get our room keys and relax in our room. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was very clean, the bed quite comfortable. We called for extra blankets and towels and had them delivered within minutes. I'd like to have had a mini bar/fridge in the room. The only negative for us was the pompous concierge--the short one on duty in the evening--
reviews.title: Great Hotel--would stay there again!

reviews.text: avoid him and talk to one of the women instead.
reviews.title: typical sheraton stay
Boston Hotel
reviews.text: Just returned from Boston today, and have to say that the Boston Sheraton was a great place to stay for the Boston Marathon and for it's location overall. I had read the prior, mixed reviews, and can tell you I was highly satisfied. We (my children and I) were on the 27th floor, nice room, nice bathroom. Everything was clean, and just what you wanted and needed in a room. The hotel pool and gym facilities were top notch. Free internet service right by the Starbucks. Concierge desk was very helpful. Lots of runners stayed there and there was a cool vibe all weekend. It was easy to get to the T, shop and eat in the Prudential Center, pick up the race packets from the attached Hynes Convention Center, and to walk around the Back Bay neighborhood.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was my second time visiting Boston. I stayed at this hotel two nights. in my opinion, the room seemed small in size. I felt like I was going to hit the nightstand when I would get out of bed. The room was clean and I had a good view from the 19th floor. The hotel location was great! It is near Fenway Park and walking distance to the Shops at Prudential Center.The T subway station is around the corner from the hotel. I am planning on returning to Boston in the winter. This hotel suits my needs. I would also consider a bit more upscale experience at the Westin or Marriott nearby!?
reviews.title: Great City Break in Boston

reviews.text: Had a friend in town so we decided to get a room right in the city. For the first night I scored a $99 room at the Westin Copley (beautiful!!). The second night they were sold out, so Priceline gave me the Sheraton for $109. Both Westin and Sheraton are considered 4 Stars. What a joke. Sheraton was disgusting. Gave us a room in the South Tower #1822. Hadn't seen a renovation in at least 20 years. Bathroom was sparse and what you'd expect in a motor lodge in a random town. Just very disappointing. South Tower is a bit scary too. Dingy dark hallways with room service trays sitting around for who knows how long. We should have asked to change rooms but were told that they were at capacity. Of course, they know you paid via Priceline so they just don't care.
reviews.title: I've stayed at better Motel 6's!!

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the Sheraton. He was attending a conference at the adjoining Hynes Convention Center. The hotel is massive. Check-in was easy. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Our room was 965 in the south tower. Upon check-in we were informed that this was the newly rennovated tower. Our room was a very nice size for a standard room. Two huge windows. Bathroom was a little small. Coffee maker was nice. No fridge or safe. The one thing that drove us crazy was no hot water. Lukewarm water, but no hot water. It was very strange. I had read that in another review, but blew it off. Nope, it's true. Having said that, the service was very good. When we arrived i called and requested extra pillows, coffee and some bathrobes. They were at my door within minutes. I had room service breakfast two mornings. Very quick, like 15 minutes. Hot and delicious. The concierge was very nice and helpful with tips and reservations for dinner. it was very nice to be able to just walk inside and within minutes be at 2 different shopping centers. There is also a Cheesecake Factory, PF Changs and Legal Seafood at these centers. Very convenient. Legal is ok, the service was horrible. Atlantic Fish Co. was wonderful and great service, highly reccomend. This hotel was ok for buisness, but if I were going back for pleasure, I would stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: OK for buisness stay

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great spot for shops and food and sights to see... but the hotel itself leaves a lot lacking, especially for the price tag. The hotel staff and such are very nice and extremely helpful, it's just the hotel itself.
reviews.title: Great location. Crappy hotel.
Dirty and in a terrible location
reviews.text: No wireless internet in the rooms - even the wired internet is pay-per-day (and not very reliable). There are limited power outlets in the room (even at the desk). No fridge, no safe. A majority of the soda machines on the floors do not work (broken $ bill changers). I checked multiple floors and other people in my group reported the same problems.
I just feel like there's a lot missing that should be standard at a large majority of hotels in the year 2008.
reviews.title: Huge, but good!

likes.disliked: — this is a very large property - be prepared to walk a lot

reviews.text: Stayed here 4 nights. I haven't looked closely at other reviews, but I really don't understand why this hotel isn't rated higher. I can say that unless the price is just hugely different, (I think the Sheraton is actually cheaper) I would stay here over the Hilton across the street any day. (I had friends staying at the Hilton - the rooms were the same, the Hilton offered a very quickie cheap free breakfast (big deal), and other then that, the Sheraton blew it away. My thoughts:
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Location - can't beat it if you're looking at the Back Bay area. The hotel is attached (we had wet cold weather for 3 days) to the Convention Center, the mall (all kinds of shops and restaurants), the Prudential building (if you have business there) and the closest T station (Prudential station). Fenway Park was a 10 minute walk one direction and Boston Commons was a 15-20 minute walk the other.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Horrible restaurant...

reviews.text: Lobby - the hotel's biggest asset in my opinion. Extremely big, open and updated, which served as a nice meeting / hangout area for the party I was traveling with. Plenty of lounge chairs, a Starbucks (service WAS slow there) and about 10 computers comfortably spaced out to access the free internet. I didn't partake of the bar or restaurant so "no comment" there, but I really don't know why anyone would eat there, as there are dozens of other choices within the block.
reviews.title: Great location & Rooms but indifferent staff

reviews.text: Rooms - small but big enough. This (like probably most hotels in the area) is an older building they've done their best to update. My one complaint w/b the shower - the shower head leaked and only about half the water came out the way it should have. (The Hilton room I saw was the exact same size.)
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Service - Thought it was good-to-great. We asked for an extra bed and it was quickly provided. The conceirge was friendly and helpful with all "how do I get here" questions. We also had a slight issue with the bill, and the Sheraton immediately took care of it in our favor, which was way above and beyond what we expected. My only other complaint (and I'm nitpicking) w/b that it seemed to take the receptionists a little too long to check people in (the computers seemed very slow).
reviews.title: Great Stay
Wonderful Stay at the Sheraton
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from a (3) day stay at the Sheraton in Boston. When we got there I was a little concerned because they were hosting an International Seafood Show, but my fears were unwarranted.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early and the room was ready as soon as we checked in. We had a King Room in the South Tower (22nd Floor) that had a beautiful view. The room was very nice, clean and up to date. We explored the hotel and ended up going to the enclosed mall at the Prudential Center. We were able to walk all the way to the Westin without ever stepping outside which was very nice. The Lobby Bar was a nice place to unwind, the bartenders are very nice, drink prices are moderate for Boston, and the bowls of snacks were wonderful.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location.
Nice but a little noisy
reviews.text: The Sheraton is very convienient to Boylston Street where there are tons of places to eat (Vinnie T's was very good for local italian, and the Whiskey is a great place to unwind with a drink) and Brassiere Jo's has a great french breakfast (on Huntington behind the Sheraton).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked to Newbury St. and then actually walked to the North End. Put on your waking shoes if you dare, or just take a cab. The Lobster Ravioli at Florentines was wonderful, and then a walk over to Mikes Pastries was a great way to end dinner.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at Sheraton Boston

likes.liked: — Excellent Location and great conveniency to T
likes.disliked: — Expensive Parking; The toilet a mismatch from its great room

reviews.text: The people in the Sheraton were very helpful with directions or just general conversation. The same goes for all the people we talked to in Boston. I will definatly stay at the Sheraton when we go back.
reviews.title: Good if you are attending a conference

likes.disliked: — no fridge in the room and it is suppose to be a 4-star hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights while attending a conference at the Hynes Convention Center. It is very convenient if you are attending a conference there since they are connected together. You never have to go outside, which was perfect for me since it was very cold when I was there!
reviews.title: Very convenient location

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is its convenience. You are connected to the Hynes Convention Center as well as the Prudential Building and its shops and also Copley Place via a covered walkway. Newbury Street is also only a short walk away with all its shops and restaurants. There is also access to a T (subway) station via the Prudential Building.
reviews.title: Worst Value I've Ever Gotten from a Hotel Stay

likes.liked: — It was conveniently located adjoining the conference center and a shopping mall.
likes.disliked: — Everything else...the service, the room, the price, the cleanliness...

reviews.text: The hotel room itself was a little tight. I'm only 4'11" and I could barely move around in the bathroom! To top it off, the bathroom floor was slightly raised higher than the floor of the room so I either tripped over that little step or stubbed my toe b/c I forgot about that difference in the floor.
reviews.title: Very Good experience

reviews.text: Room service was fast and the food was good. There's a Starbucks in the lobby, as well as a bar and a restaurant. In the lobby, they also have several computers with free Internet access and near the Concierge desk there is a computer where you can print out your boarding pass.
reviews.title: Have Stayed Almost 170 Nights in this Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that there is no soundproofing through the door. You can hear anyone walking down the hallway, especially the loud ones.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Back Bay

likes.liked: — the value, best deal in back bay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a conference that was in the adjacent conference center. You cannot ask for a better location if needing to be at the conference center. The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to walk to Boston Commons, Fenway Park, or Newbury Street. Plentry of dining options around and a huge mall connected to the hotel.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Good Location

likes.disliked: — Extra cost for internet and gym

reviews.text: The hotel itself is pretty decent. Very good accomodations and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The points I don't like is that the fitness center is privately managed and so there is an extra charge and also internet access is extra. The pool though is free. Overall a good experience. If you're visiting and want to take in the Freedom Trail and the historic sites, you may want to stay someplace closer.
reviews.title: Wonderful Location

reviews.text: The hotel is in the perfect location if you want to be in Back Bay. It is connected to the Prudential Center and in the middle of Copley Square and Back Bay, with easy walking access to Newbury Street for shopping, Boylston for nightlife, and though a bit of a hike, walkable to Fenway, the theater district and Boston Commons. If you put your sneakers on, you can take a half hour walk to Faneiul Hall.
reviews.title: no way is this place worth 400 a night!

reviews.text: The room itself was standard business class - clean, comfortable and spacious. The room lacks anything jawdropping or romantic. It is more for the business traveler with conservative, luxurious decor. The beds were comfortable and the view was poor, but if you want to feel comfortable in a clean, well maintained hotel, this is perfect for you. The bathrooms were mediocre, no granite or marble... I didnt have to wear shower shoes, but I didnt exactly feel like the shower was sparkling.
reviews.title: Great Service and Stay!

reviews.text: The lobby was always super busy, and cans are lined out front all the time. Insider's tip - if you want to take the T, walk through the Prudential Center to Boylston and you wont have to go outside... Perfect tip in the rain.
reviews.title: Wow What a great Hotel

likes.liked: — Beds and the rooms in General Beautiful
likes.disliked: — I cannot honestly say their was anything not to like, its was a Beautiful Room.

reviews.text: Too big to have any personal attention. facilities are bit old. Hotel room is ok consider if you have one of the rooms facing the river.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: Gym/pool is nice.
reviews.title: Boston Sheraton Hotel

reviews.text: Location is great, as I was attending a convention.
reviews.title: Great location in the Back Bay of Boston

reviews.text: I would choose to stay at the Westin (3 minutes walk) instead if i return to this neighbourhood again.
reviews.title: Polite but unable to help

reviews.text: I travel a lot for business and stay in at least 70 different hotels throughout the year. One of my favorite hotels in the Boston Sheraton. I have stayed there on business and also with my wife and son on vacation. The rooms on the upper floors are very large with great views of the city or the Charles River and Cambridge. It is the closest hotel to Fenway Park if you want to walk to a baseball game and it is just steps away from the great shopping and restaurants on Newberry and Boylston Street. The indoor pool is one of the biggest I've ever seen and the fitness center is loaded with strengthening machines and cardio equipment. Finally, the hotel restaurant is very good and the bar in the evening is very relaxing. I would highly recommend this hotel over many of the bigger name hotels when staying in Boston.
reviews.title: Great Location. Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I generally stay away from chain hotels, and now I remember why. The Sheraton Boston is, in general, a nice hotel but didn't offer much in the way of making their guests feel like home (like many small hotels do).
reviews.title: Nice beds...but not much else.

likes.liked: — The staff is nice and the location is good
likes.disliked: — We felt like we were being nickle and dimed for everything during our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we were greeted by the nice bellmen and they explained that it would cost $42/night to park our car! I was flabbergasted!! I figured it would cost something to park, but not that much!! We had no choice but to eat the cost. Because of it, we never got to do a few things we had planned for the week (as we were on our honeymoon and short on extra funds - after paying for the wedding itself).
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Sheraton!

likes.liked: — Location in Back Bay - Close to everything!!! Great bed too!!!
likes.disliked: — Great rooftop pool but it closed TOO EARLY!!!

reviews.title: Fun Weekend in Boston
reviews.text: When checking in, the woman at the desk overheard us talking about it being our honeymoon and upgraded us to a suite, which was quite nice.

The beds are comfy, but the room was lacking. No fridge, no safe, $5 for 30 minutes of internet use and the bathroom was pretty awful. Our apartment bathroom at home is nicer than this one...and that is saying a lot. The tub was plain, showerhead was awful and the lighting was terrible. I really expected more from a suite bathroom.
reviews.title: Watch out for breakfast at the Apropos Room

reviews.text: The Sheraton was a good place to lay our heads in between Sox games and touring the city, but we will not return.
reviews.title: select another property

likes.liked: — the view from the second room

reviews.text: I attended an event while in Boston, booked through the event organizers, and as such I did not have much interaction with the staff. Any limited interaction I had was not enough to raise any issues regarding service.
reviews.title: Good location, great view from upper floors

reviews.text: That being said, it's a pretty decent location and obviously excellent if you're there for an event at the convention center. Coming from the airport was easy enough once I figured out the route, and walking from the station by Berklee wasn't an issue because I didn't have much stuff. If you're heading in the right direction, you'll see the Prudential center buildings, as the hotels are huge. Likewise, the Sheraton is huge. This makes the view from the upper floors great from the large windows.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.text: Unless you're on the club level floors, there aren't a whole lot of extras save for the normal in-room coffee and bathroom amenities. The bathrooms in the rooms I've been in have this strange hybrid feel that is part industrial and part modern design museum- probably because of the choice of commercial-style fixtures. Regardless, they serve their purpose.
reviews.title: Convenient but to be repeated!

reviews.text: The fitness center is quite impressive- there is a large range of resistance machines, and a large number of treadmills and ellipticals- all recent stuff. The pool is in the same area but I still have yet to have the chance to use the pool.
reviews.title: Terrible service and management
Would stay again!
reviews.text: Parking is expensive. Last time I drove and parked, this time I flew. Parking for the weekend wasn't much less than the plane ticket. It's a big city, so the cost of parking shouldn't be a huge surprise. I've heard that there are cheap lots near some of the train stations further out, and some people park there and take the subway to the hotel and convention center. If you don't have much stuff, that might be the way to go, otherwise expect to pay over $100 for parking for the weekend.

The hotel is connected to the Prudential Mall, Copley Mall, and is across the street from Newbury street, lots of shopping. There is even a grocery store right around the corner. I got an incredible rate online at hotels.com for $99.00 night/prepaid and since I am a starwood member got a great room in the North Tower on the 28th floor. The room was clean, had a safe, and free internet. The bed was comfortable and the pillows great. The only minor complaint was the small bathroom and no refridgerator. The fixtures were modern, a rain shower with an adjustment for spray. They even give you a loofa sponge. I had to work at Harvard and had no problems getting around. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: I stayed for a long Labor Day weekend. The hotel was very nice if a bit far from the Freedom Trail. Room cleanliness and amenities were on par with the Sheraton brand. Staff was friendly and helpful, my room had a nice view of the river. The best feature is that it is attached to the Copley shopping mall. And the area is very trendy with lots of great places to eat and shop. I also got a great deal using Priceline's Name Your Own Price or less than $80/night.
reviews.title: Had a very nice stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Boston Sheraton was the first hotel on our trip round New England. We had a room on the 23th floor overlooking the river. Its a massive hotel and therefore very impersonal. Its part of the Prudential Centre so its easy to go shopping and eat locally if that's what you want to do.
reviews.title: OK if you are going to a conference otherwise....

reviews.text: Have the say the room was one of the smallest I have ever been in in the the USA. It was, however, comfortable and very clean.
reviews.title: Great Location for Families

reviews.text: We had discount vouchers, so the hotel breakfast turned out to be extremely good value.
reviews.title: Far from new convention center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hotel! We were on the 27th floor with an excellent view. Hotel is next to the Prudential and Copley Place Shopping Center. 15-20 min walk to Fenway Park (in case you're attending a Red Sox game).
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — I've had to pay for internet access. Considering the price for the room we've paid, I would have expected free access to be included

reviews.text: Hotel room was very clean, comfortable and the bed was excellent. This room really felt like home.
reviews.title: Great Location, Value not so Great

likes.disliked: — Tiny rooms, tiny bathroom, no storage space

reviews.text: The Sheraton offers valet parking for $39/night (quite reasonable considering the location).
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Boston for a conference during the first full week of August 2007. We paid a rate of $185 a night, which is much below the standard rate, but I feel that was still too much for what we received.
reviews.title: Can't recommend unless your company is paying
Confernce hotel
reviews.text: The Sheraton is located in the Back Bay neighborhood, and the great thing is that countless restaurants, bars, shops, and sites are within walking distance of the hotel. There is plenty to see and do! The hotel is connected to a mall which has everything you could need if you forgot something (and probably many things you don't need but its fun to shop anyway!).
I was really disappointed with this hotel
reviews.title: The do it yourself hotel, don't go

reviews.text: Rooms booked and we turned up but on arriving in our car at the front door of the hotel the portering team could not recognise a customer and family wanting some help with their luggage.
reviews.title: need restaurant

reviews.text: The hotel was very busy, is that not their business, and we waited 90 minutes before we took two rooms 11 floors apart
reviews.title: Sheraton Boston a average Sheraton Hotel

reviews.text: One was the "unlucky for some room". Next to the lift. We did not sleep well.
reviews.title: Not Friendly

reviews.text: An early departure was badly handled by the hotel. We had to get our own taxis from around the corner.
reviews.title: Great for families and pets

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there for four nights during a business convention. Overall it is a great hotel: excellent location for shopping and sightseeing (if you fancy walking), good room service, nice amnenities such as the swimming pool, the Starbucks downstairs and the link to the shopping mall. Rooms are very comfortable even if a bit small for a couple (we had to take a Queen size due to a reservation mistake from my company). The service is perfect. I am sure one can find better places elsewhere but it fulfilled my expectations.
reviews.title: Good convention place

likes.liked: — Comfortable rooms, great service, excellent location

reviews.title: Nice hotel,great location
reviews.text: We recently spent 1 night at the Sheraton for a Valentine's Day getaway. I had requested the South Tower based on reviews I read here. They gave us a nice room in the South Tower, can't comment on the North Tower-didn't really see it. Hotel is in a great location. Went to Top of the Hub for dinner-excellent!! Also, visited the North End-Little Italy-great area, can't wait to go back. Had breakfast pastry from Maria's & also Mike's Pastry-great. Now we want to go back for an Italian dinner! Took a cab from Sheraton to North End-about 11.00 each way-well worth it.

There are other better hotels in Boston. The lobby & Starbucks were great but you can get them anywhere. Our room had a good view but a terrible odour which eventually we worked out was a damp smell emanating from the floor where the carpet was soaking! Check in was no fun - rooms we booked were not availble and only after complaint did we get something vaguely acceptable. Porters were surly and unhelpful. Location was good right next to the Prudential Centre and handy for good restaurants etc.
reviews.title: Better Hotels Elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent for exploring Boston. We had booked a room on the Club Floor but unfortunately our room was located directly across from the access to the lounge. This meant that we were woken at 6.30 am from the continuous stream of hotel residents and staff going in and out of the doors which rattled and banged, causing the door to our room to rattle on its hinges.
reviews.title: Would not return

likes.disliked: — Expensive for grade of room provided

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: The room itself was a good size but in need of updating. The bathroom was very small and shabby. The sink had a huge crack in it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a little concerned reading a few of the reviews here, but we had a wonderful experience at this property. Everyone was so nice and our service was quick. Our room was in great shape and quiet considering how close we were to the elevator and ice machine. Location was great for our trip to Fenway and accessing the T via the Prudential stop.
reviews.title: Did we get lucky?

reviews.text: The hotel is well located for public transport and the staff are extremely friendly. The club lounge offers a superb view of sunset over Back Bay and my suite was reasonably spacious. The lounge is not huge so breakfast was very crowded.
reviews.title: Good location and helpful staff

reviews.text: What made my stay exceptional was the service offered by Tom Pendzic. As a platinum member, I used the late checkout facility at 4pm and mentioned that I would like to have my luggage stored until 6.30 when I would be heading to the airport. Tom immediately pointed out that I had had lounge access and he would be happy to revalidate my key card until 7pm. This does not happen very often and, usually, only after I have made a point of asking.
reviews.title: Presidential suite is amazing. Thank you Jennifer, front office manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tom has ensured that I will definitely return to the Boston Sheraton.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: I was a bit wary reading some of the negative comments posted here. But I thought the Sheraton was phenomenal.
reviews.title: Great location, hotel!

reviews.text: Thanks to previous posters, I asked for a room in the South Tower. The room was very nice - new furniture, beds, etc. Only thing was that for a "4 star" room, I was hoping for a small fridge. Bathroom was nice and clean. Had a non-smoking room and smelled 100% clean.
reviews.title: Great start, bad finish

likes.liked: — Location, rooms, free internet access in lobby

reviews.text: Location can't be beat. It's 1 block from the T (subway) and there are plenty of taxis at the hotel since it is across from the Hilton. The hotel is connected to the Prudential Center, which was a big plus. Lots of shops and restaurants at the Center and more could be found a block away on Boylston.
reviews.title: Dismal stay so don't expect much

likes.liked: — Check in staff and climate conrol system

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had no problems with the staff. Check-in was courteous and quick, although the gentleman didn't seem thrilled when I asked for a South Tower room. Housekeeping was on par and none of my belongings were missing or anything of the sort.
reviews.title: Sheraton was a great base

reviews.text: Lobby has online computer stations and a big Starbucks. Didn't get to check out any of the on-site eateries, though.
reviews.title: Generic Conventional Monster Huge Wanna-Be-Trendy Cookie Cutter

reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at the Sheraton in Back Bay. It was close to the subway system, restaurants, and shopping (it's attached to the Prudential Center). The rooms were extremely clean and well appointed.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Sheraton and were very pleased with our stay. We booked through priceline and got a rate of $105/night. We couldn't have been happier. Upon our arrival, the check in clerk upgraded to the concierge level. This included free breakfast (continental) and free snacks in the evening. We had a lovely room with fantastic view. I would agree that the room is on the smaller side and the bathroom is really tiny. Only one person can get ready at a time.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best part of this hotel is the location. The Back Bay area has a lot to do and if you aren't up for walking, the T stop couldn't be closer.
reviews.title: Excellent value, smaller room, near the action
Pet friendly, clean and ideal location
reviews.text: This hotel is great for the business and leisure traveller.
I stayed here on 10/2/09 after getting a great deal from Hotwire.com Back Bay is a great section of Boston to stay at, and sicne I had tickets to the red sox game it worked out perfectly.
reviews.title: Close to Everything !

reviews.text: Just back from a long weekend in Boston, staying at the Sheraton. The location rocks! Easy walking to the South End and Copley Square. My room was on a low floor, with no view but a great rate of $150 nightly. The room was snug, the bed was heavenly. Could not hear neighbors, hallway traffic or sounds of the city. The lobby is busy, clean and features a starbucks. The staff is attentive, which is normally unusual for a hotel of this size. It's attached to the indoor malls so if you need a "little something" it's right there. The pool has a retractable roof, which adds to the pleasure of the stay.
reviews.title: Terrifc Location, Great Hotel and Ammenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights, certainly enough time to rate this hotel. It's ideally located to stores (The Prudential Center is attached), restaurants, & attractions. The room was attractive, with lovely decor and top quality bed linens and pillows. Staff was excellent, polite and knowledgeable.We learned to share items on the two restaurant's menus as portions were large and somewhat expensive. All around a great place to stay in Boston. Did not use amenities though there were many.
reviews.title: A beautiful place to stay in Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton in Boston on a two night stay as part of our holiday. I chose this hotel for its location, which is great - down town, connecting to the Prudential Center and within walking distance of Newbury Street, Boston Common and Quincy Market. The reception staff was very friendly and professional, however the rooms are outdated and were not as clean as expected from a Sheraton. A taxi from the airport to this hotel will be 35$ and to get to Boston South Station 12$.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at this Sheraton before. We just visited again and had a great time in the city. We had a great view of the Charles River on the 22nd floor. During busy times you can take the express elevators to the 26 floor and take the stairs to the floor you need. Concert in town and the hotel was busy. No hall noise, no other room noise, air conditioning was not too loud. An overall good experience and the location is great.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: No free Wifi in rooms. It is available for an additional $9.95. I wish all hotels would just include this for free. There is a work station in the lobby area that was available for use.
reviews.title: Fantastic value, great location, wonderful views

reviews.text: I just got back from a weekend stay at the Boston Sheraton.
reviews.title: Fun weekend getaway

reviews.text: What a great time we had. We had a club floor room which was very nice. My kids ,ages 7 and 9 , LOVED the pool. They had a ball swimming in it for hours despite those ridiculous signs cordoning off 1/3 of the pool for lap swimmers ( very annoying). The pool is not run by the sheraton so you cant blame the hotel for the pool. The bar service by the pool via room service was wonderful.....great frozen margaritas ! Yummy !!
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: This hotel is in an amazing location.....perfect to go everywhere and anywhere. We did a duck tour, shopped at the Pru, walked around the back bay .
reviews.title: Don't let the hotel lobby impress you....

reviews.text: Are the rooms a little tired looking ? Yes but it didnt matter one bit to us. We were there for rest and relaxation and fun and thats what we got. The service was always terrific from room service to the bell hops to the car valets.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: Our room floor was nice and quiet which was great since my kids went to bed at 8:30. The hotel was just about full when we were there as well.Very very busy place but still wonderful.
reviews.title: well located for Fenway trip

reviews.text: Very small rooms, but we had a family of four in the room. Nice decor. The location is great. The hotel is connected to the Prudential Center Mall and convention center and very close to thousands of shops and restaurants. The pool was great for kids, it has a roof that opens and there were many families there.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel for a holiday in Boston. It's in a smart, safe area with excellent restaurants and plenty to do and see within walking distance. The hotel is attached to The Prudential Center shopping mall with all its shops and foot outlets. It couldn't be more convenient. Good quality toiletries which are topped up during your stay, Starbucks coffee with maker in the room too. Feels really luxurious and we only paid £55 per night plus tax via Priceline 'name your own price'.
reviews.title: Simply wonderful- fantastic value via Priceline

reviews.text: Great pool, gym, jacuzzi, sauna etc with sunbeds outside for the summer.
reviews.title: Wonderful Back Bay Hotel-- We Loved It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet access in small area in lobby, but there is the Apple shop of the road where you can access the internet for free day and night too.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the downside, the bath towels were a bit small- I am a woman and weigh 140lbs- they only just wrapped round!
reviews.title: Great hotel and great location

reviews.text: The Sheraton has several positive features and a few that are average. It's a nice property with a convenient location to a large mall and the Prudential T station for easy subway travel. The lobby is huge and a separate SPG Gold/Platinum desk exists, which is nice. This hotel seems to host many conventions so be aware of increased traffic and noise if you are not part of a convention.
reviews.title: Nice property but I prefer the Westin

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly but not on par with the staff at a typical Westin in terms of warmth and effort. Regular rooms are a decent size with queen beds and tight bathrooms. This is one of those urban hotels that will almost certainly require you to close the door to get yourself into the shower due to the shoebox-sized bathroom. The bed is certainly decent with adequate comfort, but the television (or its remote control, can't decide which) is very slow to respond to inputs and can be frustrating when navigating the channels. The appointments in my room were in good shape and plenty of towels, lotions, glasses, etc. were provided. I did not receive a single housekeeping visit during my entire stay due to the SPG Make a Green Choice program, which is definitely worth the 500 Starwood points to me.
reviews.title: Boston trip

reviews.text: Wireless internet was good on my laptop, but my phone could not get a connection. I assume there must have been a dead or weak spot in my room since the laptop was barely hanging onto reception, so the hotel should consider this if it's charging $10/day for access.
reviews.title: Great convention space

reviews.text: Fitness and working out on the road are very important to me but the Sheraton doesn't really deliver in this area. The cardio and resistance areas are divided into two rooms with the resistance area bordering a sauna. This makes the workout facility very warm and uncomfortable, especially when the ceilings are only about 7 feet high. There is very little space to manuever and overall, the exercise facility is a disappointment. If you are serious about working out when you travel, try Fitcorp (now Boston Sports Clubs) for a temporary pass.
reviews.title: Pleasant and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not use any of the restaurants at this Sheraton since the mall directly outside the 2nd floor had an Au Bon Pain and a Tossed for breakfast and lunch.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at the Sheraton Boston
Great location. Nice rooms. A B+ experience.
reviews.text: Stayed six days while attending a conference. Pros: Ideal location next to the Hynes Convention Center and close to Boylston St. and Newbury St., just 5 blocks or so away from Fenway Park, free Internet in the lobby.
Cons: Room walls are paper thin ... I could hear every word that my next door neighbors were saying, cardio machines in the exercise room could use some updating,
reviews.title: Spectacular panoramic view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, a good experience. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great hotel!!
Perfect location, ammenities lacking
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton for four nights while attending a conference in Boston. My room was very clean and nicely laid out. The thing that I remember the most is the wonderful panoramic view looking across the Back Bay area and over the Charles River. I was on a fairly high floor and there were no other tall buildings nearby. Any time I was in the room and not sleeping, the curtains were wide open so I could gaze out the window.
I didn't have a computer with me, and was happy to see they had several computers with large monitors in the lobby for guests to use (one had to log in with name and room number to use them).
reviews.title: New rooms are very small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went there for a conference.
reviews.title: An adequate functional hotel but nothing special.

reviews.text: Overall, this is an adequate functional hotel but nothing special.
reviews.title: Great Location Cosmopolitan Hotel

reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: The elevators were broken. Waiting 20 minutes for an elevator got to be a bit annoying as the conference went on.
reviews.title: Boston Hotel: Near Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel does not offer free WiFi in the rooms (instead, the cost is $9.95 per day)
reviews.title: Very good hotel!

reviews.text: I stay at the Sheraton Boston very regularly with work and i think it's a lovely hotel. The rooms are usually very nice and the beds are amazing. The staff are helpful and i find the Starbucks in the lobby and the free internet computers very handy. The hotel is comunicated to the Prudential shopping centre which is also linked to the Copley shopping centre so you don't have to go outside for anything, which is handy in the snowy winters. The location is excellent, with lots of restaurants and shops at its doorstep and the famous Newbury street one block away where you can find some of Boston's best boutiques, bars and restaurants. If you are visiting Boston don't hesitate and stay here, you'll have everything you want at hand.
reviews.title: Sheraton Boston

likes.liked: — The beds are really comfy, and everything is so near!

reviews.text: A convention hotel, with capricious elevators, variable rooms, expensive bland food, mediocre staff for the most part. Conveniently located; would only recommend this hotel to those attending a convention at the hotel.
reviews.title: Soulless

reviews.text: There's little that's memorable or out of the ordinary about this hotel. The location, close to the restaurants, bars and shops or Newbury and Boyleston streets, and adjoining the Prudential Center, is great. The rooms appear for the most part to be on the small side. While clean and habitable, they're not luxurious and don't appear to have been modernised in the recent past. The whole place feels very much 3 rather than 4*.
reviews.title: A reaonable, if unremarkable, hotel

reviews.text: If you can get a room at a reasonable rate (I paid $110 via Priceline), then this is reasonable enough choice. While I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying, nor would I go out of my way to choose it over other alternatives.
reviews.title: OK, nothing special
Not too happy!
reviews.text: Just returned from 6 nights at the Sheraton Boston. While the location was ideal for sight-seeing, the room itself was just ok. It was clean, but very small. The bathroom was desperately in need of renovation and there was no room for two to be standing in there at the same time. The linens were clean, but did not have the updated beds that other Starwood properties boast. The front desk staff was our only interaction and was pleasant and quick. I would stay here again for the location, but hope that they renovate before our next visit.

We arrived at 6am from Cali room wasn't ready but we had a hop on hop off trolley set up so we left our stuff. Was told by hotel they get in touch with us. Location was great in walking distance to Fenway which we had txts for and the Prudential building is attached which has restaurants, store and the subway is right there. The Old town trolley picks up in front of the hotel which is nice. We had room 2065 in the south tower we had two huge windows with spectacular views! The room is huge, king bed was comfy and shower head was strong. Once we got our room later that night we received a bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries! Will defiantly stay there when we go again.
reviews.title: Great location, view and room!!
Not Impressed
reviews.text: Just stayed over labor day weekend. The elevator situation is atrocious. Very very long waits. We had club access, but if you are not on the club floor or on one of the top floors, it is two elevator rides to the cub, and can take 10 minutes or longer. The club itself is very nice, but was absolutely over filled for breakfast. Nowhere to sit, and the poor staff who were working like crazy just couldn't keep up. The room itself was ok, a bit worn. Front desk often seemed understaffed for the number of people in the hotel. At one point I was waiting in line while two people manned the desk and several other appeared to be doing little. A manager type saw I was annoyed and demanded one of them help me. Not sure if this cuts in the hotel's favor or against it. Location is very good, which is the only reason for two stars.

For Starwood Plats, Platinum recognition was poor. I was given a regular room, though upgraded room types seemed to be on sale on spg.com. No view, middle high floor. As noted, not convenient to the club. Even though it was a points stay, the bill under my door in the morning charged me over $200. Front desk took off the charge pleasantly, but I would have preferred to avoid the hassle and it was lucky I checked. Nothing even remotely remarkable about this hotel except its location and some nice folks in the club lounge who are overworked. Ice machine worked ok. (Like to end with something positive.)
reviews.title: Boston Sheraton

reviews.text: Great location to shopping, restaurants and metro. Rooms are very clean and modern. Only down side during our stay was the elevators were very slow and there was often a long wait as construction was going on.
reviews.title: Good but can use a little work

reviews.text: I have stayed here about 4 times and have another visit booked for a conference held there. I have another conference soon and will try a new place.
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel in Boston!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I have my daughter studing at NEU, every time I travel to Boston, I stay at this Hotel, well located, special during the winter, very nice front desk staff, despite very busy with the usual conventioners...
reviews.title: very happy with my 5 stays

reviews.text: I`ll be back next month and this time bringing to me my mother in law !!
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Management Ever........Avoid EVER,EVER EVER going here!

reviews.text: We had reserved 2 hotel rooms (1 a club and the other a regular Double) months ago. 1 hour prior to our arrival (my son is in a wheelchair) we were called and told we we being moved from the Hotel to another hotel about 2 miles away. The Sheraton is attached to the convention center...hence the reason we choose it. I was livid and demanded to know why we were being moved. The manager told us it was because we had booked online and that the reservation guarantee does not apply to people who book online, also that they had over booked the hotel due to short-sightedness on their part. So, we changed direction and head to the new Hotel. Once there the new hotel told us that we only had reservations for 1 room and that it begin until the next day. I explained the situation to the front desk manager, and the first thing he asked is whether Starwood was picking up the tab. I said I didn't know and that i would call to find out. The answer from the revenue manager at the Sheraton was no...I call their corporate offices...the first thing asked by the customer service person was " Is the Sheraton paying for your room?" After a bit of being on hold , she told me that she was going to call the Sheraton and figure out what the issues were. At this point i called Marriott (who I am a platinum member) and told them the story. they had rooms available in their Copley Marriott. as I was speaking to them, the front desk person came out to me and told me our rooms were being paid for by the Sheraton. Great i thought. NOT SO, Saturday afternoon the front desk person called me over and told me that the Sheraton had reneged on its promise and was only going to pay for the first night, not the entire weekend as was their original promise (BTW, there were actually 2 reservations- one for the first night a suite - and one for the rest of the weekend - 2 rooms..a club and regular). So here I am...another day to go, and stuck in a hotel very far away from the convention, with a son in a wheel chair. It is about $ 8.00 each way. I so HATE the Starwood Hotel chains. And hope that there is an investigation into their bait and switch policies.
reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Updated Facility, Good service!

reviews.text: I knew that I was going to be checking in very late so I emailed the hotel through their website. I got a timely reply. The hotel is located in the Back Bay area and a short walk to the subway. It is connected to a shopping mall and food court, so it was very convenient for bad weather. The room was very clean and looked updated, with flat-screen TV. Internet access was an extra fee of about $10/day. Check-out was very easy with about three ways to do it. Basically, I just dropped off the room keys in a box provided in the lobby. You can also just call them and tell them you are checking out or use the check-out option on the TV.
reviews.title: Great Location - Horrible Hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel recently as a part of a large conference that was using several hotels, including the Sheraton. The location is great - easy to get around the city and in the nice area of Backbay. Also, the mall area makes it easy to do shopping if you want.
reviews.title: Beware of Sheraton Boston

reviews.text: I found this hotel to be perfect. Within walking distance of downtown and Fenway. There's a mall and convention center connected to the hotel. There's a Starbucks in the lobby, as well as a fairly nice lounge and bar, crowded by people from the conventions. There'e a T station around the corner, which connects you with the entire city. Duck tours start out back. The rooms were great, only exception being the beat up doors in the hallway. Our room had a king size bed and lots of space.
reviews.title: Has everything you'll need.

reviews.text: What a great place to stay when visiting Boston. Excellent location, friendly staff, clean, great service, etc... We stayed in the North tower with our 2 small children. They accomodated our request for a refrigerator & a port-a-crib within 30 minutes of our check-in (The port-a-crib was delivered & set-up about 5 minutes after we entered the room). Every staff member was friendly to us & the children. Our room was clean. We loved the convenience of the hotel to shops, restaurants & Boston history. You can even catch the famous DUCK & sightseeing tours right near the hotel. We would stay here again & recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Boston.
reviews.title: Excellent Boston Hotel

reviews.text: I got a "deal" for 3 nights from American Airlines with an average cost per night of about $135 which is pretty good for Boston in the summer.
reviews.title: good but a tad noisy
Sheraton Back Bay
reviews.text: The really good things: the bed is firm/soft in a very comfortable manner and the AC was QUIET!! The bathroom was clean. The overall room size was huge. The downtstairs internet computers were available 24/7 and there were enough of them so that there was no line. The nearby middle-of-the-road food choices were numerous with the Prudential Center mall and Boyston St. within 5 minutes and Jasper White's Summer Shack with good seafood across the street (and a bowling alley right there, too!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noisy part - for some reason, every room's plumbing within 3 floors could be heard in my room, even with the bathroom door closed.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here during Labor weekend because I found a pretty good deal. Just checking in took a while. As another reviewer previously mentioned there was a line just trying to check in. Not sure if it was due to the tattoo convention or college students coming back to school but it was to long of a wait just trying to check in. When we finally did they didn't have the room we had reserved. We settled for something else for the first night with the intention that they would have a room ready for us the next night. We waited quite a bit the next day to finally get our room. Joey at the front desk did go the extra mile to ensure the rest of our stay was a good one and it was so I'm very thankful for that. Other than that elevators were a little slow but I think they are doing some upgrade work on them not to mention a really busy weekend. I think its an OK place to stay. What I liked most about it was the proximity to the T Station. I would stay again if another good deal came up.
reviews.title: Ok Hotel Good Location

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay in Boston, at The Sheraton. Our room was in the south tower on the 19th floor, very quiet and comfortable. We enjoyed the swimming pool with a retractable roof. Everything is enclosed in the Prudential Center, we had beautiful weather, but even if it was raining, we were undercover most of the time. Lots of shops and restaurants to visit. We were within walking distance to The Museum of Fine Arts and also Fenway Park in Kenmore Square.
reviews.title: In the Hub of the Hub

reviews.text: I recommend this hotel, for first time visitors to Boston as well as Bostonians who would like to be a tourist in their hometown.
reviews.title: sheraton hotel in boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the sheraton hotel in Boston is in a great location. we had a great room with a great view. the staff were wonderful, I needed something from my car I had valet parked and they went out of their way to find my car. I would highly recommend this hotel when you are in Boston!
reviews.title: excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights when we recently went to Boston to drop our daughter off at college. It is conveniently located next to the Prudential building connecting the mall and other hotels. Although the room was very small, it serves the purpose of business travel or leisure in the downtown area of Boston. It's ideal for one or max two people. It will be cramped for a family unless you get a bigger room and double beds at higher price. People have mentioned in the review about the oddity of the toilet flush, but I found it rather clever to have industrial strength flushing mechanism. It will never clog! We've stayed at other hotels much more upscale than Sheraton, but the location is much better at this hotel. There are computers in the lobby to use. I really enjoyed staying at this hotel and will definitely stay here again next time I go to Boston. There are so many places to go to and fun things to do in Boston, you just need a comfortable, clean room to stay in at an excellent location and this is it.
reviews.title: Great time at the hotel!

reviews.text: Spent the last 6 nights in this hotel. Elevators over the weekend were very slow or didnt show up at all. most people we talked to had to wait from 10 to 30 minutes. Our room was small,no view but we had a nice view of the mold and mildew in the bathroom. We understand this is an older hotel but one would think they would take care of these problems as they come up. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: my stay

reviews.text: Very disappointed to pay a premium price for a name chain hotel (that I have elevated status with) and have such a poor experience. Everything worn and dirty from the hallway carpets to the bathroom to the furniture in the room. Paper thin walls, could hear everything in the hallways and the automated voice from the elevator from quite a distance. Stayed in South tower and there were just not enough elevators for the number of rooms. This was a quiet mid week stay and always waited at least 10 minutes for an elevator in either direction. Only advantage was central Back Bay location and physical link to convention center and subway. Quite a pity. I'll be coming at least 3x per year for the next 5 years and will have to cross this Sheraton off my list for any of the stays
reviews.title: Only good feature was the location

reviews.text: I am a frequent business traveler (Starwood Lifetime Platinum) who has stayed at this hotel about a dozen times in the last 5 years. The staff is always wonderful, the rooms are great, a the location the best in Boston. Several times have stayed with my family, including our dog, and we have greatly enjoyed the stay. The pool is nice, and the fitness center excellent. I highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Property

reviews.text: Just spent 3 nights at The Sheraton in Boston....super nice front desk personnel let me check into my room at 8 am!!! Room was very large, very clean, updated bathroom, working coffee maker(Starbucks) and working mini fridge too. Not available....a clock radio and when I got one it didn't work!! Efficient wake up calls tho.
reviews.title: some highs, some lows

reviews.text: as everyone else has said elevators were a nightmare...not sure how long they had been "out" but with 1500 of us attending a conference....YIKES!!! This hotel is old and you can see it in the hallways and elevators...some rooms/baths have been updated nicely ....others not so much. If you are fussy, i'd suggest you check out the room before you say "ok" and unpack...or be very specific with the front desk re: what you want/expect since rooms seem to vary even when the price is the same. My room on the 11th floor was great...no view however.
reviews.title: Ideal location and very helpful staff

reviews.text: Stayed at the Sheraton Boston for five nights over first weekend in December. What a great location - ideally located above the Prudential Center with easy access (without going outside) to get to Copley Place and surrounded by four or five T stations (the closest was Prudential).
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — Location - free internet access in lobby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked on Priceline for $110 per night using "name your price", and was allocated a room on the 17th floor directly facing the Christian Science Church. Fabulous view. Only downside was being near the lifts and that the walls weren't that thick.
reviews.title: A good hotel in great location!

reviews.text: Starbucks in lobby next to six or more free internet stations. No where really to have dinner in hotel (that I could find) but plenty of places in the adjoining shopping malls.
reviews.title: Too big for its britches

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely stay there again
reviews.title: A good base for visiting Boston

reviews.text: Recently had an enjoyable 7 night stay at the Boston Sheraton. Although more 3.5 stars than 4, it ticks all the boxes from comfort to service. Location is great due to interconnecting malls housing shops, restaurants and T stations. Good locale for all of the cities attractions. Good view over the city from the 17th floor. The only negative points were that the rooms had poor sound insulation and small signs of it being a well used hotel. Oh and the pool was closed during our stay
reviews.title: Needs some work

reviews.text: Staying at The Club Level definetly had it's perks. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I enjoyed the daily complimentary continental breakfast and h'orderves in the Club Room lined with windows.
reviews.title: Fabulous views and Great location

reviews.text: I asked for a river view room which had a huge picture window with fantastic views of the city and the Charles River from the 27th floor.
reviews.title: Great Location and service!!

likes.liked: — Upgrade to Club level with SPG gold membership

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in Back Bay and within walking distance of the "T" and all the quaint restaurants.
reviews.title: Worked for us

reviews.text: Parking was the only drawback - on street parking for visitors is extremely limited, parking at the hotel is $39/day
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Bathrooms are Lacking

reviews.text: The Sheraton Boston was a great place to stay. It is close to everything and the T stop is very convenient. You do not have to leave the hotel- just go throught the lobby to the Prudential mall and catch the T. The trolly tours pick up right outside the hotel and the Duck tours are close too. The views are great from the club level floors. The service was excellent. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Don't stay in the north tower

reviews.text: Don't expect much at this hotel. When I checked in there was only one person at the registration desk with a line of people. The lobby is worn and a mix of old dated stuff and some signs of infused renovation. The elevators run very slow. The rooms are small and a bit shabby despite some updating. Bathroom was very small with shower in bathtub but water pressure was good. Flat screen TV in room. The fitness center was a highlight with lots of equipment and a large indoor pool. Meeting room facilities were ok at best. I would not recommend for a vacation stay.
reviews.title: worn down convention hotel in heart of Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four nights at the hotel, not a really four stars hotel, i mean not an european standard, but it was good, nice room, nice position very close to prubential station.....
reviews.title: Nice place.....confortable position

reviews.text: We hadn't breakfast, but starbucks is in the hotel!!!!!
reviews.title: perfect location

reviews.text: this was the perfect spot for college visits -- b.u., northeastern and berkeley school of music all within an easy walk. also close to newbury street shopping and even walked thru boston common to quincy market and faneuil hall.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, good deal

reviews.text: slow elevators though.
reviews.title: Nice comfortable stay

description: Business-friendly Sheraton Boston Hotel, which is connected to Hynes Convention Center, is 4 miles from Logan Airport and close to the Shops at Prudential Center, Copley Place, and Newbury Street.
